commitMessage:
refactor(architecture): fix graph generation by using toolchain config

## What Changed
- Added graph_command configuration to dependency-cruiser in .hodge/toolchain.yaml
- Refactored ArchitectureGraphService to read from toolchain config instead of tool registry
- Removed findGraphTool() method (35 lines) - no longer needed
- Changed to read tool name from analysisConfig.architecture_graph.tool
- Changed to read graph_command from toolchainConfig.commands[tool].graph_command
- Improved command security validation to distinguish safe patterns (||, &&) from unsafe ones
- Extracted validateToolConfig() helper method to reduce cognitive complexity
- Removed unused imports (yaml, ToolRegistry) from ship.ts
- Updated tests to match new behavior (removed toolRegistry parameter, fixed error messages)
- Modified 4 files: 74 insertions, 86 deletions (net -12 lines)

## Why This Change
The architecture graph generation was broken because it tried to find tools in the tool registry, but dependency-cruiser doesn't exist there. The tool registry pattern doesn't work for architecture graphing since it's tool-specific configuration that belongs in toolchain.yaml.

This refactoring fixes the issue by:
1. Making graph_command explicitly configurable in toolchain.yaml (like other tool commands)
2. Reading the configured tool name from the analysis config
3. Reading the graph_command from the toolchain commands section
4. Eliminating the dependency on tool registry for architecture graphing

The security validation was also improved to properly allow boolean operators (|| for error handling, && for chaining) while still blocking actual injection vectors.

## Impact
- **Fixed Functionality**: Architecture graph generation now works correctly
- **Better Architecture**: Configuration lives in the right place (toolchain.yaml, not tool registry)
- **Cleaner Code**: Removed 35 lines of unnecessary findGraphTool() logic, reduced cognitive complexity
- **Improved Security**: More precise validation distinguishes safe vs unsafe shell patterns
- **Consistent Pattern**: Follows same pattern as other toolchain commands
- **No Breaking Changes**: Existing toolchain.yaml configurations continue to work
- **All Tests Passing**: 1,357 tests pass, zero TypeScript errors, zero ESLint errors

## Technical Details
The root cause was architectural - trying to use tool-registry.yaml (which defines cross-project tool capabilities) for project-specific command configuration. Architecture graph commands are inherently project-specific (different paths, different options per project) and belong in toolchain.yaml.
